mechanoreception.notes: Whip scorpions possess a whiplike tail, suggesting a mechanosensory function for detecting air currents or physical contact. General arachnid sensory biology also suggests this.

chemoreception.notes: Vinegaroons discharge an offensive, vinegar-smelling liquid (acetic acid) when attacked, implying a developed sense of smell for both themselves and potential predators/prey.

vision.notes: The presence and capabilities of vision in Thelyphonidae are not explicitly mentioned. Arachnids have varied visual systems, ranging from simple light detection to more complex image formation.
